text:
This bug has already been reported (http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=apache-
bugdb&m=101613481110058&w=2) some time ago. Can anyone tell me if it has been 
fixed, and if so, in what version?
creator: mishagale@fastmail.fm
slive@apache.org
text:
This is not a bug.  Any directory that has AllowOverride set to anything
other than "none" must be readable by the webserver.  Otherwise, a small
mistake in directory permissions could compromise the security of the
web server.

The correct solution is simply
<Directory />
AllowOverride none
</Directory>
<Directory /home/*/public_html>
AllowOverride All
</Directory>

or a similar configuration.

creator: mishagale@fastmail.fm
text: Ahh, good. This has fixed problem, thanks very much Joshua
